intro: Licania densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered licania, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. Licania densiflora is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect and bird species.
